newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo aluminium futures climb, helped by dlr, LME.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo aluminium futures climb, helped by dlr, LME.

text.p: Tokyo yen-based aluminium futures finished higher on Tuesday, helped by the dollar's advance against the yen and the metal's performance in London since Friday, traders said.

"The dollar has gained slightly and aluminium rose on the LME," said one trader. "But aluminium doesn't look particularly strong on the LME. They (Tokyo contracts) would ease as well when the LME prices come down."
The Tokyo market was closed for a national holiday on Monday. The dollar traded at well above 116 yen in Asia on Tuesday.
The Tokyo June contract gained 2.1 yen to 192.8, while the April added 2.2 yen to 193.8. Others were up by 2.2 to 2.5 yen.
In London overnight, three month aluminium finished up $1.50 at $1,609 per tonne after breaching the key $1,600 level on Friday, when it clawed up $28.50.
